items.title: New Climate Data Depict a City More at Risk
items.abstract: More than 800,000 New York City residents will live in flood zones by the 2050s, according to warnings issued by the Bloomberg administration, which hopes to encourage better preparation for climate change.
keywords: New York City Panel on Climate Change

items.title: New York City Creates Replacement for Student Data Website
items.abstract: A website for the city’s public schools will allow parents to view information on their children like attendance and report card grades.

items.title: A New City, Built Upon Data, Takes Shape in South Korea
items.abstract: Fifty-four families volunteered to share data on everything from sleeping habits to trash volume to help developers make a city from scratch in Busan.

items.title: New York City to Consider Banning Sale of Cellphone Location Data
items.abstract: A bill would make it illegal for cellphone companies and mobile apps to share user location information collected in the city without a customer’s explicit permission.

items.title: Data Show New York Police Are Resuming Their Work
items.abstract: Arrests and tickets have yet to reach the same levels as in past years, but the rebound further indicates that a slowdown is over.
